package.name: gnumeric
package.summary: A spreadsheet for GNOME
package.description:
Importing XLS files from Excel is only the beginning: This full-featured spreadsheet is remarkably powerful and easy to use. If you are familiar with Excel, you're ready to get to work with Gnumeric. More functionality is available through plugins such as guppi.
Gnumeric is part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: libole2-devel
package.summary: Libraries, includes, etc to develop libole2 applications
package.description: Libraries, include files, etc you can use to develop libole2 applications.

package.name: imlib-devel
package.summary: Development tools for Imlib applications.
package.description:
The header files, static libraries and documentation needed for developing Imlib applications. Imlib is an image loading and rendering library for X11R6.
Install the imlib-devel package if you want to develop Imlib applications. You'll also need to install the imlib and imlib_cfgeditor packages.

package.name: imlib
package.summary: An image loading and rendering library for X11R6
package.description:
Imlib is a display depth-independent image loading and rendering library. Imlib is designed to simplify and speed up the process of loading images and obtaining X Window System drawables. Imlib provides many simple manipulation routines which can be used for common operations.
Install imlib if you need an image loading and rendering library for X11R6. You may also want to install the imlib-cfgeditor package, which will help you configure Imlib.

package.name: gnome-pilot
package.summary: Tools for using GNOME with Palm OS devices
package.description: GNOME Pilot is a collection of programs and daemons for using Palm OS-based systems with GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: libghttp-devel
package.summary: GNOME http client development
package.description: Libraries and includes files you can use for libghttp development

package.name: libglade
package.summary: The libglade library for loading user interfaces
package.description:
Library to load GNOME user interface files at runtime This library allows programs to load externally-stored user interfaces (.glade files) into your program at runtime. External storage of the interface permits alteration of the interface without recompiling.
You can change the interface by editing the .glade files or by using GLADE.
GLADE and the libglade libraries are part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-pilot-devel
package.summary: GNOME pilot libraries, includes, etc
package.description: gpilotd libraries and includes.

package.name: xmms
package.summary: Audio player for the X Window System
package.description: XMMS (formerly known as X11Amp) is an X/GTK+ based audio player for various audio formats. . It's able to read and play: * Audio MPEG layer 1, 2, and 3 (with mpg123 plug-in), * WAV, RAW, AU (with internal wav plug-in and MikMod plug-in), * MOD, XM, S3M, and other module formats (with MikMod plug-in), * CD Audio (with CDAudio plug-in), with CDDB support, * .cin files, id Software. It has eSound, OSS, and disk writer support for outputting sound. . It looks almost the same as the famous Winamp, and includes those neat features like plug-ins, several of which come bundled, a spectrum analyzer, oscilloscope, WinAmp skins support, and a playlist window.

package.name: gnome-print
package.summary: Printing libraries for GNOME
package.description: This package contains the printing apparatus for GNOME, the complete graphical desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: libgnomeprint11
package.summary: Printing libraries for GNOME
package.description: This package contains the printing apparatus for GNOME, the complete graphical desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: gtk+-devel
package.summary: Development tools for GTK+ (GIMP ToolKit) applications.
package.description:
The gtk+-devel package contains the static libraries and header files needed for developing GTK+ (GIMP ToolKit) applications. The gtk+-devel package contains glib (a collection of routines for simplifying the development of GTK+ applications), GDK (the General Drawing Kit, which simplifies the interface for writing GTK+ widgets and using GTK+ widgets in applications), and GTK+ (the widget set).
Install gtk+-devel if you need to develop GTK+ applications. You'll also need to install the gtk+ package.

package.name: gnome-utils
package.summary: Useful tools for GNOME: calculator, time-tracker, and more
package.description:
This package contains:
gcalc - a simple calculator gcolorsel - a color selector gdialog - a Gtk version of the 'dialog' program gfontsel - a font selector ghex - a hex editor gless - a Gtk version of the 'less' pager gnome-run - a graphical utility to execute a user entered command gpenguin - a penguin that follows the mouse grun - a minimal graphical utility to execute a user entered command gsearchtool - a tool for finding and grepping through files gshutdown - reboot or shutdown your machine gstripchart - plot system measurements gtt - a task timer/tracker guname - display 'uname' information about your system gw - display users on the system, like 'w' idetool - an IDE disk viewing tool splash/splac - splash screen renderer
All of these applications are part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: xmms-gnome
package.summary: XMMS - applet for controlling xmms from the GNOME panel.
package.description: GNOME applet for controlling xmms from the GNOME panel

package.name: pygtk-libglade
package.summary: A wrapper for the libglade library for use with PyGTK
package.description: This module contains a wrapper for the libglade library. Libglade is a library similar to the pyglade module, except that it is written in C (so is faster) and is more complete.

package.name: gnomeicu
package.summary: GnomeICU is a clone of Mirabilis' popular ICQ written with GTK
package.description: GnomeICU is a clone of Mirabilis' popular ICQ written with GTK. The original source was taken from Matt Smith's mICQ. This is meant as a replacement for the JavaICQ, which is slow and buggy. If you would like to contribute, please contact Jeremy Wise <jwise@pathwaynet.com>.

package.name: dia
package.summary: A GTK+ based diagram editor and charting tool
package.description: Dia is used to draw diagrams, graphs, charts, and so forth. This is an early version, but the program is fully usable. In this version there is support for UML static structure diagrams (class diagrams), Entity-Relationship diagrams and Network diagrams. Diagrams can be exported to postscript.

package.name: libghttp
package.summary: GNOME http client library
package.description: This packages provides the include files and static library for the Gnome HTTP functions like HTTP 1.1 requests. This library is part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gimp-devel
package.summary: GIMP plugin and extension development kit
package.description: Static libraries and header files for writing GIMP plugins and extensions.

package.name: libsigc++
package.summary: The Typesafe Signal Framework for C++
package.description:
This library implements a full callback system for use in widget libraries, abstract interfaces, and general programming. Originally part of the Gtk-- widget set, libsigc++ is now a seperate library to provide for more general use. It is the most complete library of its kind with the ablity to connect an abstract callback to a class method, function, or function object. It contains adaptor classes for connection of dissimilar callbacks and has an ease of use unmatched by other C++ callback libraries.
Package GTK-- (gtkmm), which is a C++ binding to the GTK+ library, starting with version 1.1.2, uses libsigc++.

package.name: control-center
package.summary: The GNOME Control Center
package.description: This package contains utilities to configure the GNOME desktop. The GNOME Control Center allows you to alter the appearance, focus behavior, screen saver, keyboard and mouse properties, and more. It's part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-applets
package.summary: Small applications which embed themselves in the GNOME panel
package.description: From clocks and utilities to network tools to very small games, these programs run inside your GNOME Panel.

package.name: xmms-mikmod
package.summary: XMMS - Input plugin to play MODs.
package.description: Input plugin form XMMS to play MODs (.MOD,.XM,.S3M, etc)

package.name: Gtk-Perl
package.summary: Perl Gtk and GNOME bindings.
package.description: A set of perl bindings for Gtk, Imlib, GNOME, Glade, and GtkXmHTML.

package.name: eog
package.summary: The Eye of GNOME image viewer
package.description: eog, the Eye of Gnome, is a graphics viewer for GNOME which uses the gdk-pixbuf library. It can deal with large images, and zoom and scroll with constant memory usage. The goal is a standard graphics viewer for future releases of Gnome.

package.name: libxml
package.summary: Library to let GNOME applications use XML
package.description: This library lets GNOME applications use XML, a metalanguage to let you design your own markup language. A regular markup language defines a way to describe information in a certain class of documents (eg HTML). XML lets you define your own customized markup languages for many classes of document. It can do this because it's written in SGML, the international standard metalanguage for markup languages.

package.name: gdk-pixbuf-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for application development with gdk-pixbuf
package.description: Libraries, include files, etc you can use to develop gdk-pixbuf applications.

package.name: libgtop
package.summary: Library for the gtop system monitoring tool
package.description:
A library that fetches information about the running system such as CPU and memory useage, active processes and more.
On Linux systems, this information is taken directly from the /proc filesystem while on other systems a server is used to read that information from places like /dev/kmem and others.
Libgtop and gtop are part of GNOME, the complete desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: pygnome-applet
package.summary: Python bindings for GNOME Panel applets.
package.description: This module contains a wrapper that allows GNOME Panel applets to be written in Python.

package.name: librep-devel
package.summary: development libraries and headers for librep
package.description: This contains the required files to develop software using the librep lisp environment.

package.name: libxml-devel
package.summary: Libraries, includes and other files to develop libxml applications.
package.description: The libxml-devel package contains the libraries, include and other files you can use to develop libxml applications.

package.name: sawfish
package.summary: A highly configurable and extensible X11 window manager.
package.description: Sawfish is an extensible window manager using an Emacs LISP-like scripting language. All window decorations are configurable, and the Lisp language controls as much user-interface policy as possible. This is not a layer on top of twm, but a wholly new architecture.

package.name: libgtop-devel
package.summary: Libraries, includes and other files to develop LibGTop applications.
package.description: Install this package if you wish to develop applications that access information on system statistics such as CPU and memory usage.

package.name: audiofile-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for audiofile application development
package.description: Libraries, include files and other resources you can use to develop audiofile applications.

package.name: gal-devel
package.summary: Development files for the GNOME Applications library
package.description: Development files for the GNOME Applications library

package.name: libgal1
package.summary: The G Apps Lib
package.description: A collection of GNOME widgets and utility functions.

package.name: bug-buddy
package.summary: Utility to ease the reporting of bugs within the GNOME Desktop Environment
package.description: A graphical bug reporting tool for GNOME, bug-buddy makes reporting bugs very simple and easy for the user, while making the reports themselves more useful and informative for the developer.

package.name: gnome-media
package.summary: A set of multimedia utilities for GNOME
package.description:
This package contains gmix, a mixer; gtcd, a CD player; and vumeter, a sound output monitor.
The GNOME media utilities are part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: libgal3
package.summary: The GNOME Application Library
package.description: A collection of GNOME widgets and utility functions.

package.name: gnome-libs
package.summary: Main GNOME libraries
package.description: GNOME (GNU Network Object Model Environment) is a user-friendly set of GUI applications and desktop tools to be used in conjunction with a window manager for the X Window System. The gnome-libs package includes libraries that are needed to run GNOME.

package.name: gnome-print-devel
package.summary: Libraries and include files for developing GNOME applications.
package.description: This package contains the printing apparatus for GNOME, the complete graphical desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: pilot-link-devel
package.summary: Pilot development header files.
package.description: This package contains the development headers that are used to build the pilot-link package. It also includes the static libraries necessary to build static pilot apps.

package.name: gnome-pim
package.summary: A calendar and address book (Personal Information Manager) for GNOME
package.description: This package contains a calendar tool with notifications and multiple views, and an address book. Gnome-pim is part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: glib
package.summary: A library of handy utility functions
package.description:
This library is a collection of handy utility functions. It is designed to solve some portability problems and provide other useful functionality which most programs require.
GLib is used by GDK, GTK+ and many applications. You should install th glib package because many of your applications will depend on this library.

package.name: imlib-cfgeditor
package.summary: A configuration editor for the Imlib library.
package.description:
The imlib-cfgeditor package contains the imlib_config program, which you can use to configure the Imlib image loading and rendering library. imlib_config can be used to control how Imlib uses color and handles gamma corrections, etc.
If you're installing the imlib package, you should also install imlib_cfgeditor.

package.name: gedit
package.summary: A small but powerful text editor for GNOME.
package.description:
gEdit is a small but powerful text editor designed expressly for GNOME.
It includes such features as split-screen mode, a plugin API, which allows gEdit to be extended to support many features while remaining small at its core, multiple document editing through the use of a 'tabbed' notebook and many more functions.

package.name: mc
package.summary: A user-friendly file manager and visual shell
package.description: Midnight Commander is text-based (but feature-rich!) file manager reminiscent of the Norton Commander on steroids. Capabilites include mouse support (for both xterm and console), undelete (ext2 filesystems only), FTP, and binary and text editing. MC is also capable of most system administration tasks, including the browsing, unpacking, and installation of deb, rpm, zip, zoo, and tar.gz files.

package.name: pygtk
package.summary: Python bindings for the GTK+ widget set.
package.description:
PyGTK is an extension module for Python that gives you access to the GTK+ widget set. Just about anything you can write in C with GTK+ you can write in Python with PyGTK (within reason), but with all of Python's benefits. PyGTK provides an object-oriented interface at a slightly higher level than the C interface. The PyGTK interface does all of the type casting and reference counting that you'd have to do yourself using the C API.
Install pygtk if you need Python bindings for the GTK+ widget set.

package.name: librep
package.summary: An embeddable Emacs-Lisp-like runtime library
package.description:
This is a lightweight LISP environment for UNIX. It contains a LISP interpreter, byte-code compiler and virtual machine. Applications may use the LISP interpreter as an extension language, or it may be used for standalone scripts.
Originally inspired by Emacs Lisp, the language dialect combines many of the elisp features while trying to remove some of the main deficiencies, with features from Common Lisp.

package.name: helix-sweetpill
package.summary: The Helix-Sweetpill suite of Sawfish themes
package.description: A collection of themes for the Sawfish window manager.

package.name: libunicode-devel
package.summary: Development libraries, header files and utilities for libunicode
package.description: libunicode is a library for manipulating Unicode characters and strings. It understands both the UTF-8 and UCS-2 encodings, and has a framework for adding support for new encodings.

package.name: glib-devel
package.summary: The GIMP ToolKit (GTK+) and GIMP Drawing Kit (GDK) support library.
package.description:
The glib development package includes the static libraries and header files for the support library for the GIMP's X libraries (GTK+ and GDK), which are available as public libraries.
Install glib development if you want to develop programs which will use gLib.

package.name: gal
package.summary: The GNOME Application Library
package.description: A collection of GNOME widgets and utility functions.

package.name: rep-gtk-libglade
package.summary: Glade binding for librep
package.description: This is a binding of libglade for the librep Lisp interpreter.

package.name: gnome-core-devel
package.summary: GNOME core libraries, headers and more.
package.description: Panel libraries and header files for creating GNOME panels.

package.name: xsane
package.summary: An X Window System front-end for the SANE scanner interface.
package.description: XSane is an X based interface for the SANE (Scanner Access Now Easy) library, which provides access to scanners, digital cameras, and other capture devices. XSane is written in GTK+ and provides control for performing the scan and then manipulating the captured image.

package.name: gnome-pim-devel
package.summary: GNOME PIM development files
package.description: Files needed to develop apps which interact with gnome-pim applications via CORBA.

package.name: swig
package.summary: Generate scripting interfaces to C/C++ code.
package.description: SWIG is a compiler that makes it easy to integrate C and C++ code with scripting languages including Perl, Tcl, and Python. Swig takes a set of ANSI C/C++ declarations and generates an interface for them to your favorite scripting language.

package.name: pygnome
package.summary: Python bindings for the GNOME libraries.
package.description:
PyGNOME is an extension module for python that gives you access to the base GNOME libraries. This means you have access to more widgets, simple configuration interface, metadata support and many other features.
Install pygnome if you need Python bindings for the GNOME libraries.

package.name: pygnome-libglade
package.summary: GNOME support for the libglade python wrapper
package.description: This module contains GNOME support to suppliment the libglade python wrapper. Libglade is a library similar to the pyglade module, except that it is written in C (so is faster) and is more complete.

package.name: gnome-users-guide
package.summary: The official User's Guide for GNOME
package.description: This is the official Users Guide for GNOME, written by the GNOME Documentation Project. You can learn more about the project at http://developer.gnome.org/projects/gdp. Please feel free to join in - information on how to do so is also on the project page.

package.name: ORBit-devel
package.summary: A high-performance CORBA Object Request Broker.
package.description: This package contains the header files, libraries and utilities necessary to write programs that use CORBA technology. If you want to write such programs, you'll also need to install the ORBIT package.

package.name: pan
package.summary: A USENET newsreader for GNOME
package.description: This is version 0.9.1 of Pan, a GNOME newsreader. Pan is GTK-based, supports multiple servers, threading, and multi-part binaries. Both lightweight and fast, it also includes some highly useful binary-processing features.

package.name: gimp
package.summary: The GNU Image Manipulation Program
package.description:
The GIMP is an image manipulation program suitable for photo retouching, image composition and image authoring. Many people find it extremely useful in creating logos and other graphics for web pages. The GIMP has many of the tools and filters you would expect to find in similar commercial offerings, and some interesting extras as well.
The GIMP provides a large image manipulation toolbox, including channel operations and layers, effects, sub-pixel imaging and anti-aliasing, and conversions, all with multi-level undo.
This version of The GIMP includes a scripting facility, but many of the included scripts rely on fonts that we cannot distribute. The GIMP ftp site has a package of fonts that you can install by yourself, which includes all the fonts needed to run the included scripts. Some of the fonts have unusual licensing requirements; all the licenses are documented in the package. Get ftp://ftp.gimp.org/pub/gimp/fonts/freefonts-0.10.tar.gz and ftp://ftp.gimp.org/pub/gimp/fonts/sharefonts-0.10.tar.gz if you are so inclined. Alternatively, choose fonts which exist on your system before running the scripts.

package.name: libvorbis
package.summary: The Vorbis General Audio Compression Codec
package.description: Ogg Vorbis is a fully open, non-proprietary, patent-and-royalty-free, general-purpose compressed audio format for audio and music at fixed and variable bitrates from 16 to 128 kbps/channel.

package.name: libogg-devel
package.summary: Ogg Bitstream Library Development
package.description: The libogg-devel package contains the header files and documentation needed to develop applications with libogg.

package.name: abisuite
package.summary: An easy to use word-processor
package.description:
AbiWord is the first part of a complete, open source office suite. AbiWord is based on GTK and the original source includes crossplatform support for win32 and BeOS.
AbiWord is still being developed. It's quite usable but not yet full- featured or polished. For many applications, however, it should prove effective and efficient.

package.name: gtk+
package.summary: The GIMP ToolKit (GTK+), a library for creating GUIs for X.
package.description:
The gtk+ package contains the GIMP ToolKit (GTK+), a library for creating graphical user interfaces for the X Window System. GTK+ was originally written for the GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program) image processing program, but is now used by several other programs as well.
If you are planning on using the GIMP or another program that uses GTK+, you'll need to have the gtk+ package installed.

package.name: gaim
package.summary: A client for AOL's 'Instant Messenger' service
package.description:
Gaim allows you to talk to anyone using AOL's Instant Messenger service (you can sign up at http://www.aim.aol.com). It uses the TOC version of the AOL protocol, so your buddy list is stored on AOL's servers and can be retrieved from anywhere.
It contains many of the same features as AOL's IM client while at the same time incorporating many new features.

package.name: libgnomeprint6
package.summary: Printing libraries for GNOME
package.description: This package contains the printing apparatus for GNOME, the complete graphical desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: rep-gtk
package.summary: GTK binding for librep
package.description: This package provides an interface to the GTK graphical toolkit for the librep lisp interpreter.

package.name: ggv
package.summary: GNOME GhostView, a PDF and PostScript viewer
package.description: GNOME GhostView (ggv) is a graphical frontend to ghostscript which allows you to view and print postscript and pdf documents. It is both simple and easy to use, and offers a variety of zoom and anti-aliasing options. . Gnome GhostView (ggv) is part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: mcserv
package.summary: Server for the Midnight Commander network file management system.
package.description:
The Midnight Commander file management system will allow you to manipulate the files on a remote machine as if they were local. This is only possible if the remote machine is running the mcserv server program. Mcserv provides clients running Midnight Commander with access to the host's file systems.
Install mcserv on machines if you want to access their file systems remotely using the Midnight Commander file management system.

package.name: gdk-pixbuf
package.summary: Image loading library used with GNOME
package.description:
The GdkPixBuf library provides a number of features:
- Image loading facilities. - Rendering of a GdkPixBuf into various formats: drawables (windows, pixmaps), GdkRGB buffers. - A cache interface

package.name: swig-examples
package.summary: Examples for applications of SWIG.
package.description: Examples for applications of SWIG.

package.name: control-center-devel
package.summary: The GNOME Control Center development environment
package.description:
The control-center-devel package contains the development environment needed for creating the `capplets' used in the GNOME Control Center.
If you're interested in developing capplets for the GNOME control center, you'll want to install this package.

package.name: gmc
package.summary: The GNOME version of the Midnight Commander file manager.
package.description:
GMC (GNU Midnight Commander) is a file manager based on the terminal version of Midnight Commander, with the addition of a GNOME GUI desktop front-end. GMC can FTP, view TAR and compressed files and look into RPMs for specific files.
Install gmc if you're installing GNOME and you'd like to use the Midnight Commander file manager with it.

package.name: sane
package.summary: Scanner access software.
package.description: Scanner Access Now Easy (SANE) is a universal scanner interface. The SANE application programming interface (API) provides standardized access to any raster image scanner hardware (flatbed scanner, hand-held scanner, video and still cameras, frame-grabbers, etc.). If they're using SANE, developers can write image-processing applications without having to think about the peculiarities of individual devices. SANE also makes it possible to write a device driver once, which can then be used by any SANE-compliant application. SANE currently includes drivers for some Epson SCSI scanners, HP ScanJet SCSI scanners, Microtek SCSI scanners, Mustek SCSI flatbed scanners, PINT devices, most UMAX SCSI scanners, Connectix QuickCam, and other SANE devices via network. Note that this package does not enable network scanning by default. If you wish to enable network scanning, read the saned(1) manpage. If you'd like to develop SANE modules, you should also install the sane-devel package.

package.name: esound
package.summary: The Enlightened Sound Daemon
package.description:
EsounD, the Enlightened Sound Daemon, is a server process that mixes several audio streams for playback by a single audio device. For example, if you're listening to music on a CD and you receive a sound-related event from ICQ, the two applications won't have to jockey for the use of your sound card.
Install esound if you'd like to let sound applications share your audio device.

package.name: sane-devel
package.summary: The SANE (a universal scanner interface) development toolkit.
package.description: Static libraries and header files for writing Scanner Access Now Easy (SANE) modules. SANE is a universal scanner interface which is included in the sane package.

package.name: gtk-engines
package.summary: Themes for GTK
package.description: The gtk-engines package contains shared objects and configuration files that implement a number of GTK+ theme engines. Theme engines provide different looks for GTK+, so that it can resemble other toolkits or operating systems. The gtk-engines package contains graphical engines for various GTK+ toolkit themes, including Notif, Redmond95, Pixmap and Metal (swing-like).

package.name: gnucash
package.summary: GnuCash is an application to keep track of your finances.
package.description: GnuCash is a personal finance manager. A check-book like register GUI allows you to enter and track bank accounts, stocks, income and even currency trades. The interface is designed to be simple and easy to use, but is backed with double-entry accounting principles to ensure balanced books.

package.name: xmms-devel
package.summary: XMMS - Static libraries and header files.
package.description: Static libraries and header files required for compiling xmms plugins.

package.name: gtop
package.summary: The GNOME system monitor
package.description: This package will install the GNOME system monitor gtop, which shows memory graphs and processes. It's part of GNOME, the friendly graphical desktop environment built entirely from free software.

package.name: xsane-gimp
package.summary: A GIMP plugin which provides a scanner interface.
package.description: This package is the same as the regular XSane program, but it works as a GIMP plugin. You must have GIMP installed to use this package.

package.name: gnome-core
package.summary: The core programs for the GNOME GUI desktop environment.
package.description:
The gnome-core package includes the basic programs and libraries that are needed to install GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.
You should install the gnome-core package if you would like to use the GNOME desktop environment. You'll also need to install the gnome-libs package. If you would like to develop GNOME applications, you'll also need to install gnome-libs-devel.

package.name: gnome-libs-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for GNOME application development
package.description:
GNOME (GNU Network Object Model Environment) is a user-friendly set of GUI applications and desktop tools to be used in conjunction with a window manager for the X Window System. The gnome-libs-devel package includes the libraries and include files that you will need to develop GNOME applications.
You should install the gnome-libs-devel package if you would like to develop GNOME applications. You don't need to install gnome-libs-devel if you just want to use the GNOME desktop environment.

package.name: gphoto
package.summary: A digital camera application
package.description: gPhoto is a GTk-based application and library framework that lets you download images from several different digital camera models, and from the local harddrive, and generate HTML albums. It is free software.

package.name: libunicode
package.summary: A Unicode character manipulation libary
package.description: libunicode is a library for manipulating Unicode characters and strings. It understands both the UTF-8 and UCS-2 encodings, and has a framework for adding support for new encodings.

package.name: xmms-gl
package.summary: XMMS - Visualization plugins that use the Mesa3d library.
package.description: Visualization plugins that use the Mesa3d library.

package.name: pilot-link
package.summary: PalmOS link utilities
package.description: This suite of tools allows you to upload and download programs and data files between a *nix machine and Palm OS-based devices. It has a few extra utils that will allow for things like syncing the Pilot's calendar app with ical. Note that you might still need to consult the sources for pilot-link if you would like the Python, Tcl, or Perl bindings.

package.name: ORBit
package.summary: A high-performance CORBA Object Request Broker
package.description:
ORBit is a high-performance CORBA (Common Object Request Broker Architecture) ORB (object request broker). It allows programs to send requests and receive replies from other programs, regardless of the locations of the two programs. CORBA is an architecture that enables communication between program objects, regardless of the programming language they're written in or the operating system they run on.
You will need to install this package and ORBIT-devel if you want to write programs that use CORBA technology.

package.name: rep-gtk-gnome
package.summary: GNOME binding for librep
package.description: This is a binding of the various GNOME libraries for the librep Lisp interpreter. It includes support for the basic GNOME functions, the GNOME user interface widgets, and the GNOME Canvas architecture.

package.name: grip
package.summary: Grip, a CD player and ripper/MP3-encoder front-end
package.description: Grip is a gtk-based cd-player and cd-ripper. It has the ripping capabilities of cdparanoia builtin, but can also use external rippers (such as cdda2wav). It also provides an automated frontend for MP3 encoders, letting you take a disc and transform it easily straight into MP3s. The CDDB protocol is supported for retrieving track information from disc database servers. Grip works with DigitalDJ to provide a unified "computerized" version of your music collection.

package.name: libsigc++-examples
package.summary: examples and tests for the Typesafe Signal Framework for C++
package.description: Source code of example and test programs for libsigc++.

package.name: xmms-esd
package.summary: XMMS - Output plugin for use with the esound package.
package.description: Output plugin for xmms for use with the esound package

package.name: memprof
package.summary: Memory profiler and leak detector
package.description: Memprof is a tool for profiling memory usage and detecting memory leaks. It can be used with existing binaries without need for recompilation.

package.name: gnome-iconedit
package.summary: GNOME Icon Editor
package.description:
GNOME IconEdit is a lightweight graphics tool ideal for creating simple icons or cursors.
IconEdit is part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: helix-update
package.summary: The Helix GNOME distribution updater
package.description: The Helix GNOME distribution updater helps you keep track of updates, bug-fixes, and new software. It determines available updates for your system that can be downloaded and installed automatically from the Internet. This is all done without sending any data to Helix Code.

package.name: pygnome-capplet
package.summary: Python bindings for GNOME Panel applets.
package.description: @SUSE_NMS_FALSET@this module contains a wrapper that allows GNOME Control Center capplets to be in Python.

package.name: sawfish-themer
package.summary: GUI for creating sawfish themes.
package.description: Optional theme builder for sawfish. Allows static window themes to be created/edited in a graphical environment.

package.name: sawfish-themes
package.summary: A collection of themes for the sawfish window manager
package.description: This is a collection of themes for the Sawfish window manager written by John Harper <jsh@users.sourceforge.net>. They can be found on sawmill.themes.org. Sawfish can be found at http://sawmill.sourceforge.net

package.name: gnome-pim-conduits
package.summary: Gnome Pilot conduits for GnomeCal and GnomeCard
package.description:
The gnome-pim-conduits package includes the conduits needed to connect your PalmPilot with gnome-pim applications.
Currently these conduits are present:
- gnomecal : synchronizes your GnomeCal calendar with your Palm's calendar - gnomecard: synchronizes your contact list

package.name: libglade-devel
package.summary: The files needed for libglade application development.
package.description: The libglade-devel package contains the libraries, include files, etc., that you can use to develop libglade applications.

package.name: esound-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for EsounDapplication development
package.description: Libraries, include files and other resources you can use to develop EsounD applications.

package.name: gimp-perl
package.summary: GIMP perl extensions and plugins
package.description: This is a collection of plugins for the gimp written in perl, and the perl modules needed to use them.

package.name: libole2
package.summary: Structured Storage OLE2 library
package.description: A library containing functionality to manipulate OLE2 Structured Storage files. It is used by Gnumeric from Gnome, AbiWord from AbiSuite and by other programs.

package.name: libvorbis-devel
package.summary: Vorbis Library Development
package.description: The libvorbis-devel package contains the header files and documentation needed to develop applications with libvorbis.

package.name: gnapster
package.summary: GTK client for the Napster online mp3 community (GNOME version)
package.description: Gnapster is a powerful client for the Napster online mp3 community. Currently, Gnapster supports all major features of the protocol in cluding many opennap extensions to the protocol.

package.name: libsigc++-devel
package.summary: development tools for the Typesafe Signal Framework for C++
package.description: Static libraries and header files needed for development with libsigc++.

package.name: gdm
package.summary: The GNOME Display Manager, a login manager
package.description:
Gdm provides the equivalent of a "login:" prompt for X displays- it pops up a login window and starts an X session.
It provides all the functionality of xdm, including XDMCP support for managing remote displays.
The greeting window is written using the GNOME libraries and hence looks like a GNOME application- even to the extent of supporting themes! By default, the greeter is run as an unprivileged user for security.

package.name: glade
package.summary: Tools for building GTK+ graphical interfaces
package.description:
GLADE is a free user interface builder for GTK+ and GNOME. GLADE can produce C source code; C++, Ada95, Python and Perl support is also available, via external tools which process the XML interface description files output by GLADE. GLADE supports most GTK+ 1.2 widgets. Support for styles, however, is not complete.
Install glade if you need an interface builder for GTK+ and GNOME.

package.name: audiofile
package.summary: Library to handle various audio file formats.
package.description: Library to handle various audio file formats. Used by the esound daemon.

package.name: gob
package.summary: George Lebl recreates c++.
package.description: George Lebl recreates c++.

package.name: libogg
package.summary: Ogg Bitstream Library
package.description: Libogg is a library for manipulating ogg bitstreams. It handles both making ogg bitstreams and getting packets from ogg bitstreams.

package.name: xchat
package.summary: A GNOME Internet Relay Chat (IRC) client
package.description: The full GNOME version of an attractive IRC client with full DCC and plugin support, text-color and shading transparency, tabbed channel seperation, and more.
